instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-3437 - No Audio
threads.message:
Pretty Much Clean however, no AUDIO.
1-  Audio codec recognized in the System
2 - Volume bar available
3 - No audio on the Headphones or speakers.

Any hint?

threads.title: 820-3437 - No Audio
threads.message: As first step, try known good LIO board/flex.

threads.title: 820-3437 - No Audio
threads.message: That was the first thing i did.

threads.title: 820-3437 - No Audio
threads.message: Inspect J9500 internal contacts and solders...

threads.title: 820-3437 - No Audio
threads.message:
OSX recognizes headphones insertion?
Connect/disconnect and check if audio output switches from speakers to headphones.

threads.title: 820-3437 - No Audio
threads.message:
Yes, the OSX Recognized the headphone. 
Everything looks fine. But no audio at all.

threads.title: 820-3437 - No Audio
threads.message:
Try another speaker, just for test.
Headphones comes out from codec directly; very strange symptom.

Check AUDIO_PWR_EN, SPKRAMP_SHDN_L and PP1V5_S0SW_AUDIO.
